data.event: Presidio de San Bernardino was established in 1776 and abandoned in 1780.
Presidio de San Bernardino was established in 1776 and abandoned in 1780.

event.title: established Camp San Bernardino in the latter half of the 19th century near the presidio, and in 1910

data.event: The United States Army established Camp San Bernardino in the latter half of the 19th century near the presidio, and in 1910 Camp Douglas was built next to the town.
The town is named after mining pioneer Dr. James Douglas and was incorporated in 1905.
The Calumet and Arizona Company Smelter was built in 1902.
The Copper Queen operated in Douglas from 1904 until 1931, when the Phelps Dodge Corporation purchased the Calumet and Arizona Company and took over their smelter.

event.title: 1931, when the Phelps Dodge Corporation purchased

data.event: The Copper Queen operated in Douglas from 1904 until 1931, when the Phelps Dodge Corporation purchased the Calumet and Arizona Company and took over their smelter.

event.title: were not taken down until January 13, 1991

data.event: The smoke stacks of the smelter were not taken down until January 13, 1991.
